conclusion: Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, calculated using the formula a = Δv / Δt.
At t = 1, the velocity (v1) is +2 m/s; at t = 3, the velocity (v3) is -2 m/s.
The change in velocity (Δv) is calculated as v3 - v1 = -2 - (+2) = -4 m/s.
The change in time (Δt) is calculated as t3 - t1 = 3 - 1 = 2 s.
The acceleration (a) is calculated as Δv / Δt = -4 / 2 = -2 m/s².
The negative sign of acceleration indicates that the particle is decelerating.
The acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is -2 m/s².
